alert.note: Alert for Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact northwestern Pender County through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penderlea, or 7 miles southwest of Wallace, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Penderlea, Willard and Watha. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 395. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
